title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
summary: When Dr. Henry Jones Sr. suddenly goes missing while pursuing the Holy Grail, eminent archaeologist Indiana Jones must follow in his father's footsteps and stop the Nazis.
critic_reviews: The Harrison Ford-Sean Connery father-and-son team gives Last Crusade unexpected emotional depth, reminding us that real film magic is not in special effects.
Though it cannot regain the brash originality of ''Raiders of the Lost Ark,'' in its own way 'The Last Crusade' is nearly as good, matching its audience's wildest hopes.
It is just as well that Last Crusade will indeed be Indy's last film. It would be too sad to see the series grow old and thin, like the James Bond movies.
Start lining up now, bring a bullwhip -- and maybe some d-Con. Indiana will do the rest.

Despite strong acting (the slapstick energy between Ford and Connery is wasted), obligatory chases and stunts and splendid art direction, the virtuoso technique evident in every frame remains formulaic--unaccompanied by revelation, epiphany or surprise.

The first of Spielberg's films to make us feel heavy in our seats, the first to leave us sitting, passive and uninvolved, on the outside. Watching it, you feel that nearly anyone could have directed it.

reviews.content: I still don't care too much for the opening, which tries to explain some of the back story of the Indiana Jones character (fear of snakes, the whip and fedora, etc.); but the rest of this film mesmerizes me.  The addition of Connery to theI still don't care too much for the opening, which tries to explain some of the back story of the Indiana Jones character (fear of snakes, the whip and fedora, etc.); but the rest of this film mesmerizes me.  The addition of Connery to the cast (as Indy's father) is a nice touch, providing further insight into the character development, though it does seem to be pushed a bit past the limit at times.  Still, in a film-ic version of old serials, limits were made to be pushed.  There is not much time to relax during the entire running time, but I don't see that as a problem.  The humor (through both the Marcus Brody and Saliah characters, as well as the interplay between the Fords) is in just about the right proportion (again though, it does push the limits).  The storyline harkens back to the "Raiders" style, drawing on religious themes and including everyone's favorite bad guys:  Nazis.  It's flicks like this which go a long ways to atoning for past mistakes (re:  "Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom").
Last of the three original Indiana Jones Movies with Sean Connery. Adds a new Flair to Indiana Jones,   providing good  chemistry between Ford and him
My favorite movie! The plot was the best and the scenes were epic! The actors definitely improved from the previous movies. What can i really say? Stop reading and start watching!

This movie is so good that it makes it very hard to say which of the Indiana Jones is the best. The film hits all the right notes, as the first one did, with the Spielberg magic at its highest, everything is just like you would expect it andThis movie is so good that it makes it very hard to say which of the Indiana Jones is the best. The film hits all the right notes, as the first one did, with the Spielberg magic at its highest, everything is just like you would expect it and like it to be in an Indy film. A great entertainment for all ages that will never get old or tired.

Raiders of the Lost Ark was absolutely brilliant, while Temple of Doom was pretty good if disappointing. The Last Crusade improves on Temple of Doom while just lacking the brisk efficiency of Raiders. It looks fabulous and has a great musicRaiders of the Lost Ark was absolutely brilliant, while Temple of Doom was pretty good if disappointing. The Last Crusade improves on Temple of Doom while just lacking the brisk efficiency of Raiders. It looks fabulous and has a great music score. The script is deliciously witty especially with the interplay between Ford and Connery, and the story is engaging. The action is epic, and I liked the neat sequence at the beginning that explains things such as Indy's fear of snakes and how he got the scar on his chin. Steven Spielburg does an excellent job directing, while both Harrison Ford and Sean Connery(in a masterstroke of casting) are perfectly cast as Indy and Indy's father. On the whole, exciting, witty and fun. 9/10 Bethany Cox

Many people will say that this movie and the first Indiana Jones movie are the best two in the whole series, and they are right! This movie is again filled with action, excitement, adventure and humor. The chemistry between Harrison FordMany people will say that this movie and the first Indiana Jones movie are the best two in the whole series, and they are right! This movie is again filled with action, excitement, adventure and humor. The chemistry between Harrison Ford and Sean Connery is fantastic. The music of John Williams is great as always, the main theme just doesn't get old... it's one of the most famous themes in the history of film music. Indiana Jones is kicking some nazi butt as usual, this time pursuing the Holy Grail, and while he's at it also finding his father dr. Henry Jones senior who has been kidnapped. This time Indiana gets to see Hitler eye to eye, and he even gets his autograph. The Last Crusade gets a score of 10 out of 10, just like the first Indiana Jones movie Raiders of the Lost Ark.

Everything clicks in this action-packed cliffhanger. In his third (and what for years what thought to be his last) adventure, Indy is on the hunt for that ultimate treasure, the Holy Grail. Along the way he must contend with Nazis, a secretEverything clicks in this action-packed cliffhanger. In his third (and what for years what thought to be his last) adventure, Indy is on the hunt for that ultimate treasure, the Holy Grail. Along the way he must contend with Nazis, a secret brotherhood and, of course, snakes. Sean Connery is a wonderful addition as Indy's father, and the chemistry between he and star Harrison Ford may just be one of the best in film history. The movie is a true rarity in that its attempts to outdo each preceding chase sequence succeed. Though children might have trouble interpreting the plot, this crusade is one people of all ages will enjoy.

It's getting better, better, and more fun, Indiana Jones And The Last Crusade is another fantastic adventure, Harrison Ford as usual, always great, and Sean Connery who's doing an amazing performance, Raiders Of The Lost Ark is the beginningIt's getting better, better, and more fun, Indiana Jones And The Last Crusade is another fantastic adventure, Harrison Ford as usual, always great, and Sean Connery who's doing an amazing performance, Raiders Of The Lost Ark is the beginning yet a great adventure, The Temple Of The Doom is the craziest one, and The Last Crusade is the most fun, i highly recommended.

The movie still has its adventurous spirit with a bad ass performance by Harrison Ford. However, the movie  may be boring for some of those who already have watched its prequels due to the extreme similarity. Overall if you like adventures, aThe movie still has its adventurous spirit with a bad ass performance by Harrison Ford. However, the movie  may be boring for some of those who already have watched its prequels due to the extreme similarity. Overall if you like adventures, a great movie to watch.
The best of all of the Indiana Jones.

In my opinion the best film in the entire series, The Last Crusade was a huge step up from Temple of Doom and a huge improvement from Raiders of the Lost Ark. Why? The action was better, the plot was more engaging and probably the mainIn my opinion the best film in the entire series, The Last Crusade was a huge step up from Temple of Doom and a huge improvement from Raiders of the Lost Ark. Why? The action was better, the plot was more engaging and probably the main highlight is the father and son chemistry between Harrison Ford and Sean Connery  that completely made the film so damn enjoyable.

The best opus of the Saga. Great acting, specially from Ford and Connery. This movie is a perfect mix of humour, action and good scenario . No doubt it's a cult movie !"Pro" critic reviews is just a joke, it deserves, at least a 80  rating !
It's flabbergasting that this movie has a 66/100 metascore from "critics".  not sure what they were smoking back in 89 but this movie is unsurpassable in the Action/Adventure genre.

This film is excellent, it really holds up to the first 2 without a doubt and is way better the disappointingly over awful fourth film, Harrison Ford and Sean Connery's on screen chemistry is brilliant, easily one of Sean Connery's bestThis film is excellent, it really holds up to the first 2 without a doubt and is way better the disappointingly over awful fourth film, Harrison Ford and Sean Connery's on screen chemistry is brilliant, easily one of Sean Connery's best movies.  Really entertaining throughout.

Not as good as Raiders of the Lost Ark, but better than Temple of Doom. The Last Crusade plays it safe by going back to the more successful style of the franchise's first installment, which was welcomed by fans after some didn't approve ofNot as good as Raiders of the Lost Ark, but better than Temple of Doom. The Last Crusade plays it safe by going back to the more successful style of the franchise's first installment, which was welcomed by fans after some didn't approve of Doom's dark tones.

"The Last Crusade" is the final film in the original Indiana Jones trilogy - and fittingly, the most entertaining of them all. This time, Indy's dad joins the adventure, played by Sean Connery, and the chemistry between these two gives the"The Last Crusade" is the final film in the original Indiana Jones trilogy - and fittingly, the most entertaining of them all. This time, Indy's dad joins the adventure, played by Sean Connery, and the chemistry between these two gives the movie a fantastic human center quite unique to the series. They find themselves on a quest to prevent the Nazis from acquiring the Holy Grail - and yeah, although this is essentially a rehash of the original, it's just so damn much fun that you simply don't care or even really notice. I'd seen films 1 and 3 several times before I suddenly realized how similar they were, and that's the impressive strength of "Last Crusade" - you get so caught up in everything with Indy and his dad, so swept up in spectacular chase sequences, that they could be after the Ark a second time and you still wouldn't care. "Raiders" may have established this traditional Indy formula, departed from only in the very different "Temple of Doom", but it is perfected and tied with a bow here in "Last Crusade". The music is at its best, the action is at its best, the characters are at their best, and of course Spielberg is at his best. It's a straight-up A-grade thrillride.

Until the last half hour or so, Last Crusade was a pretty solid film. It's just the ending was so painfully stupid, It sort of ruined the film for me. I mean sitting through it for 2 hours for that ending was sort of disappointing.

Geared towards 12 year olds. The dialogue is so cheesy, it makes you cringe. Every single scene is so made, it is just way too obvious that there is a camera on the other side. Sean Connery as Indiana's dad is completely and utterly miscast.Geared towards 12 year olds. The dialogue is so cheesy, it makes you cringe. Every single scene is so made, it is just way too obvious that there is a camera on the other side. Sean Connery as Indiana's dad is completely and utterly miscast. The rest of the characters are all too cliche. The entire story is so bad, it is just plain boring.

Harrison Ford saves the day again along with Sean Connery.
Love this film, not quite as good as Raiders but still highly entertaining, Ford and Connery are hilarious. Great ending.

One of the more worthy installments of the franchise, containing a hefty amount of laughs, lots of stunning effects and some great chemistry between Connery and Ford. A great conclusion to a classic franchise.
A great film! I just loved it and its my second fav Indiana Jones film. Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade 8.9/10

The fast-paced third installment is brainy, exciting and it's better than both of its predecessors. It's not as dark as "Temple of Doom", and there are scenes that are just hilarious. This is a thrill ride and it won't leave you disappointed.

Unlike the disappointment that "The Temple Of Doom" was for me, I really enjoyed "The Last Crusade". It was filled with action, comedy, a great musical score, great acting and great directing just like the original "Raiders of the Lost Ark".Unlike the disappointment that "The Temple Of Doom" was for me, I really enjoyed "The Last Crusade". It was filled with action, comedy, a great musical score, great acting and great directing just like the original "Raiders of the Lost Ark". And unlike The Temple of Doom it has no annoying girl screaming through the whole thing lol.. This is my second favourite Indiana Jones movie, with "Raiders of the Lost Ark" being my favourite.
One of the more worthy installments of the franchise, containing a hefty amount of laughs, lots of stunning effects and some great chemistry between Connery and Ford.

The third Indiana Jones movie is fantastic, and probably the best of the series, because its thematic is fun and good to explore and in the hands of Spielberg, this is perfect, because nothing could be better than Idiana Jones and James Bond,The third Indiana Jones movie is fantastic, and probably the best of the series, because its thematic is fun and good to explore and in the hands of Spielberg, this is perfect, because nothing could be better than Idiana Jones and James Bond, fighting Nazis while discussing the relationship of father and son and the holy graau hunting.

This is the BEST Indiana Jones film of the series with a very witty and well written script that makes it feel fresh and new, fantastic performances by Harrison Ford and Sean Connery really make this film hilarious and awesome, the directionThis is the BEST Indiana Jones film of the series with a very witty and well written script that makes it feel fresh and new, fantastic performances by Harrison Ford and Sean Connery really make this film hilarious and awesome, the direction and tone (Spielberg does a fantastic job at focusing the film on certain spots), the action is top notch epic, the adventure tone is very well done and is done in a sort of race tone which makes it more fun and enjoyable and the music is wonderful (once again Williams is amazing!).  This film packs it all in and tops the others in every way possible and makes one of the greatest adventure films ever made!

The third installment to the Indiana Jones trilogy (I do not count the fourth one) is very refreshing and unlike most second sequels, still has a lot of energy and hope. Sean Connery is great as Indy's befuddled father who was never there forThe third installment to the Indiana Jones trilogy (I do not count the fourth one) is very refreshing and unlike most second sequels, still has a lot of energy and hope. Sean Connery is great as Indy's befuddled father who was never there for his son as a child.
A great finale to the Indie Trilogy (Crystal Skull doesn't exist I tell you!). Sean Connery is brilliant as Indie's Dad as the religious archifact adventures of our favourite archaeologist continue.
Sean Connery and Harrison Ford...father and son? its great. This movie like its predacessors is alot of fun. Harrison really shines in this film and boy do things go down hill in the next one.....

While the special effects are just as top-notch as ever, it's in the character scenes between Harrison and Sean where the film really shines.  They share such great chemistry the audience truly believes they could be related.
It is the worst of the franchise . Not only historically incorrect , it is unfunny. It is rather insulting for some. I will stick with the second one.

To quote Dr. Sheldon Cooper (actor Jim Parsons) from "The Big Bang Theory": "Indiana Jones is the love child of Steven Spielberg and George Lucas". Harrison Ford has always been charming and great in his movies. But his roles as theTo quote Dr. Sheldon Cooper (actor Jim Parsons) from "The Big Bang Theory": "Indiana Jones is the love child of Steven Spielberg and George Lucas". Harrison Ford has always been charming and great in his movies. But his roles as the archeology professor with an appetite for adventures put viewers all over the world in excitement and contentment. Indiana Jones is without a doubt an unforgettable character. "The Last Crusade" is the third movie which on my opinion is the best. I've watched it countless times. The father - son relationship between Harrison Ford and Sean Connery (who plays his father) is remarkable. The wittiness, dangers situations and the funny commentaries from Ford and Connery makes this movie so much different, special and unique from the others. All that combined with the wonderful presence of the late Denholm Elliot and John Rhys Davies blasts the movie extremely high. Spielberg and Lucas did create a masterpiece which will outlive us and will always fascinate everyone. All of those who love adventures, danger, adrenaline, history will enjoy to the max this epic production.

I am extremely biased, having first seen it at around 11 or 12, I was and still am enthralled by this movie. From the score(which I happen to be listening to right now) to the several favorite movie lines, ie-“you lost today kid, but youI am extremely biased, having first seen it at around 11 or 12, I was and still am enthralled by this movie. From the score(which I happen to be listening to right now) to the several favorite movie lines, ie-“you lost today kid, but you don’t have to like it.” To the non-stop action, funny moments and epic cinematography. This is Spielbergs best, ET comes a close second, or it’s a tie.Go watch it, immediately.

Sean Connery is great as Indy's father and Harrison is, of course, awesome as Indy Jones. An excellent movie.
It is very good. Much better than Temple of Doom but not nearly as good as Raiders.
The 2nd best Indi movie after Raiders. I'm surprised it doesn't fair well with the critics, this is a classic in my opinion.
Another good adventure moie with Indiana Jones. However, I really think the search for religious artifacts was becoming tiresome by this point.

It was good but not that good. I think Sean Connery was a great addition and works well with Harrison Ford. The rest of the cast was fine as well. I would have liked it see it be more original then the previous films but it was still a solidIt was good but not that good. Ford and Connery worked well together here. A vast improvement upon Temple ofThis was my favorite of the series when I was a child, but Raiders is just a better movie. I love the banter between father and son in this particular installment. Ford and Connery worked well together here. A vast improvement upon Temple of Doom. This is the second best of all four movies.

Compared to the first two I think the third installment was just a little under, but only by a little as all three films were very good. Indy is back of course but this time joined by his Father, played by Sean Connery. It's a decent additionCompared to the first two I think the third installment was just a little under, but only by a little as all three films were very good. Indy is back of course but this time joined by his Father, played by Sean Connery. It's a decent addition to the series with enough entertainment similar to the first two films, but I think it's starting to miss the freshness that the original had, and the new twists brought in the sequel. Overall still a good film and a great series of movies from the 80's.

Great cinematography, excellent plot, much better actors and classic & spectacular action-sequences.This third movie truly is greater that its predecessors. It's one fun and entertaining movie.7.8/10

Fantastic cast and direction. Borrows heavily from the format of raiders but that's hardly a flaw. Solid direction and production value all around. Shame the screenplay isn't quite as tight as raiders but it's a must watch for series fans.

The best of the Indianan Jones movies. The addition of Sean Connery and River Phoenix alone is remarkable as both were great actors. The dynamic between Indianan Jones and his father (Sean Connery’s role) is some of the best (estranged)The best of the Indianan Jones movies. The addition of Sean Connery and River Phoenix alone is remarkable as both were great actors. The dynamic between Indianan Jones and his father (Sean Connery’s role) is some of the best (estranged) father / son relationships in movies. Then there is River Phoenix who is only used in the introduction scenes but it is one of the best introduction scenes in movie history and tells you everything that you need to know about Indiana Jones. Also praiseworthy Paul Maxwell role here as man with the panama hat (Don't know if he is even named in the movie). Short appearance but so memorable that everyone remembers him. But lets go back to the movie. After the legendary good introduction scene Indiana Jones is informed that his father is gone missing on his search for the Holy Grail. The Grail is his fathers lifelong obsession and Indiana Jones only goes on a journey to save his father as they have a rocky relationship and are a bit estranged. This is the beginning of a legendary adventure. The story is excellent and I do not see any flaws here. It has the right pacing and a good mix of action, humor, good twists and character development. I know I sound like a fan boy here but its one of the best performances from director Steven Spielberg, writer George Lucas and the whole team. Lets go to the actors. Harrison Ford is always great in his signature role (Even in Kingdom of the Crystal Skull) and this is his best performance as Indiana Jones. I already praised Sean Connery and this is also one of his most remembered roles outside of James Bond. River Phoenix died far to young and would be possibly one of the most acclaimed actors in Hollywood today. Paul Maxwell shines in such a small role. John Rhys Davies and Denholm Elliot return to their roles and this improves this movie too. Both are fan favorites and well remembered characters too. They have again not the longest screentime but make a great performance. Then there are the antagonists I wont spoil here. All are excellent and enjoyable villains. This is such a great cast and an awesome performance. The script, actors and directing accomplish each other. This movie has so many memorable scenes be it the humorous (Non spoilery example: No tickets, the special “autograph” or the stamp joke), action scenes (No spoilers here) or character developments (Again no spoilers here). Again the sets and special effects are top notch and everything looks amazing and believable. Also again we got the famous and legendary John Williams for the score. He should have deserved more credits as he improved every movie where he made the score. Overall while there is no perfect movie this comes close. It became the gold standard for Indiana Jones movies and action adventures while also becoming a cult classic. I rewatch it once in a while because it is a movie you can enjoy again and again.

Indiana Jones's secrets are revealed in this extremely entertaining adventure,where he is forced to work with his father in order to solve the mystery.Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade is the last piece of gold in the Indiana Jones franchiseIndiana Jones's secrets are revealed in this extremely entertaining adventure,where he is forced to work with his father in order to solve the mystery.Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade is the last piece of gold in the Indiana Jones franchise and it's pure entertainment.

It should be clear to all that The Last Crusade is easily the best in the Indiana Jones series. Its comedy and wit gives it charm and breathes new life into the series, much needed after the dark Temple of Doom.

Definitely the best of the Indiana Jones films. An effective use of comedy in an action/adventure film that doesn't take itself too seriously. I recommend this film for a fun, worry-free weekend evening.

The 1989 sequel Indiana Jones And The Last Crusade, on the other hand, both recovers Raiders' spirit and adds a layer of human warmth. Trotting from Utah to Venice to Berlin to the Middle East in search of the Holy Grail, Ford is forced toThe 1989 sequel Indiana Jones And The Last Crusade, on the other hand, both recovers Raiders' spirit and adds a layer of human warmth. Trotting from Utah to Venice to Berlin to the Middle East in search of the Holy Grail, Ford is forced to team up with estranged father Sean Connery. The two stars have a natural chemistry, and even though some of the big setpieces seem like rehashes of the first film, Crusade possesses a sweetness that no other Indiana Jones movie can claim. Even when Ford and Connery are pursuing game as big as the Grail, their personal quests keep bringing them back to each other. It's a small world after all.

"Indiana Jones and The Last Crusade" was a very good film, somewhat obscure, but interesting, we explored a bit about the Nazis, and I see that I think the Nazis are more enemies than the other enemies explored in this franchise, and I loved"Indiana Jones and The Last Crusade" was a very good film, somewhat obscure, but interesting, we explored a bit about the Nazis, and I see that I think the Nazis are more enemies than the other enemies explored in this franchise, and I loved the Father-son relationship of this film.

There's no negatives that doesn't have a 0 in it. Why the 0's? Why do you have to be in movies like these? Why couldn't you just go for my 0's so we can show some disrespect towards my 0's? A fun ride for everyone.

This remains one of the best conclusions to one of the best movie trilogys of all time. While it once again feels like the other two, it has better moments, and introduces us to India's father, who we start to see a strong father son relationship.
This movie has a lot going for it, but for me it doesn't do that much. It has entertaining scenes in it, but sometimes they become a little stupid. But it does have a fun adventure.

Last Crusade is a satisfying conclusion to the original Indiana Jones trilogy. After the departure that was "Temple of Doom", this installment brings back most of what made "Raiders" great, and that's a good thing. Once again, the actionLast Crusade is a satisfying conclusion to the original Indiana Jones trilogy. After the departure that was "Temple of Doom", this installment brings back most of what made "Raiders" great, and that's a good thing. Once again, the action sequences are riveting. The story, though it may seem familiar, is still interesting. The characters, both new and returning, are great. If you enjoyed the first Indy movie, you'll more than likely enjoy this one.

Without falling short of Raiders of the Lost Ark, it's a great trilogy closing, with everything an adventure movie needs. Indiana Jones forms an unequal but powerful couple with his father. To see with a large bag of popcorn.

Indiana Jones & The Last Crusade is definitely the best film in the trilogy. Great cast, great story and interesting plot with visiting many places. In general, The Last Crusade is one of the best adventure films, looking at it I drewIndiana Jones & The Last Crusade is definitely the best film in the trilogy. Great cast, great story and interesting plot with visiting many places. In general, The Last Crusade is one of the best adventure films, looking at it I drew parallels with Uncharted. Indiana Jones is definitely Harrison Ford's best career role on the line with Rick Deckard.

Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade was released in 1989 and was directed by Steven Spielberg. This is the third movie in the franchise and the final movie in the original trilogy and follows Indy searching for the Holy Grail, accompanied byIndiana Jones and the Last Crusade was released in 1989 and was directed by Steven Spielberg. This is the third movie in the franchise and the final movie in the original trilogy and follows Indy searching for the Holy Grail, accompanied by his father.I know that I've said this in every Indiana Jones review so far but Harrison Ford is still amazing as Indiana Jones with his charisma and intelligence making him such a likeable character. Sean Connery is also amazing as his father and they both share similar characteristics; intelligent, charismatic and daring. Their chemistry and the way they work together on screen is also great and they genuinely feel like father and son. What I also like about his character is that he doesn't feel slapped in and unnecessary just because they could have him in the movie and actually serves an important purpose to the story.I liked the side-characters of Sallah (who is back again from his first appearance in Raiders) and Marcus Brody as you could tell their characters weren't completely sure what they were getting into and had some quite goofy characteristics. However, this wasn't in an annoying way and instead added a much lighter tone to the story when it was required which helped give their characters a good reason to be there.There was definitely comedy in the previous two (well, maybe not as much in Temple of Doom) but in this film there are many more laughs than in the previous, many of the jokes coming from Indy's interactions with his father and that's another reason why I love this duo so much.The action is done very well like the other two films with great cinematography and lots of tension. I wouldn't say the action is as good as Raiders but it was certainly better than Temple of Doom.I prefer this one more than the others in the trilogy because it features a more personal story whereas in the others it was just a case of 'hey, let's go on an adventure'. What makes this one more personal is that it explores Indy's life much more by showing his younger days at the start and then obviously introducing his father which adds a lot more depth to the story.Overall, I loved this film. I liked it more than the other two because of its more personal story and more memorable characters. The action, while still great, isn't as good as Raiders but I found the great story and setting to be the highlight and stole the show for me. I would highly recommend this film, especially if you want to relieve yourself of the dark tone of Temple of Doom.8.5/10
Not as good as one and two, but still great. It had a good story, but still had boring parts at the start. The acting is excellent and they are funny. It is worth a watch.
Another Amazing AdventureThe Last Crusade is a very well written, fun, and visually appealing movie in the Indiana Jones franchise.
Kind of low production looking, but better looking production value than Temple of Doom for sure. Fun action adventure romp. Grab a bucket of popcorn and enjoy.

Steven Spielberg's Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade is an amazing concluding chapter of the original Indiana Jones trilogy. The music is still iconic, the action sequences are still great, and the story is once again, unique. Overall thisSteven Spielberg's Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade is an amazing concluding chapter of the original Indiana Jones trilogy. The music is still iconic, the action sequences are still great, and the story is once again, unique. Overall this is a fantastic film.

Harrison Ford is back as Indiana Jones once again and this is the best one yet. Steven Spielberg once again delivers a fun, entertaining film with a usual amazing story, great cinematography, and solid acting
Just like the first 2 films, great locations, props, and performances. It bit corny at times but still not too far out. A must see film if you have seen the previous 2 films.

In this film, the third in the franchise Indiana Jones, the most famous explorer of cinema will accompany his father on a quest for the Holy Grail. Directed by Steven Spielberg, this film has screenplay by Jeffrey Boam, and has Harrison FordIn this film, the third in the franchise Indiana Jones, the most famous explorer of cinema will accompany his father on a quest for the Holy Grail. Directed by Steven Spielberg, this film has screenplay by Jeffrey Boam, and has Harrison Ford and Sean Connery in the lead roles.After the debacle of "Temple of Doom", this film intensified interest in the franchise and revive her success. In fact, the team formed by Ford and Connery is unstoppable and gives pleasure to see how professional is their interaction on screen. There are two established actors, Ford is very well suited with his role and Connery is a veteran with decades of experience and versatility. This clearly benefited the film, where these two artists outshines the rest of the cast, especially in humor moments, tearing laughter to the public. The script is good, all that "Temple of Doom" had to be and was not, recovering the vivacity and adventurous spirit that had been so intense in "Raiders of Lost Ark". The final sequences, filmed in one of the most stunning scenery I know - the Nabataean ruins of Petra in Jordan - are worthy of staying in memory of any movie lover. The photography is excellent, the visual and sound effects have great quality, some costumes were very well thought out and the soundtrack, not surprisingly, has fulfilled her role.It's no coincidence that there is a division on what is the best movie of this franchise: "Raiders of the Lost Ark" or this one. There are some similarities between them, especially concerning the quality of final product. For me, if "Raiders" had a greater script and spirit of adventure, "Last Crusade" offset any fault with better humor, a stunning scenery and some breathtaking action scenes.

A fun and exciting action-adventure that marks a big improvement over Temple of Doom.  It's much lighter and less violent than it's predecessors.  I LOVE the father-son banter between Indy and Henry (Harrison Ford and Sean Connery) - it's theA fun and exciting action-adventure that marks a big improvement over Temple of Doom.  It's much lighter and less violent than it's predecessors.  I LOVE the father-son banter between Indy and Henry (Harrison Ford and Sean Connery) - it's the best relationship in the series!
my personal faviourte of the franchise good dynamic between indy and his father great film

A better return to the original movie with added new twists and a great story. Only complaint: it went on for too long as well as treaded a lot of the same ground as the original.
A brilliant return to form movie that is often debated for the title of best indiana jones film

I got a chance to see this one as a limited re-release for the first time. Harrison Ford is just so amazing as Indy the addition of Sean Connery is perfect. His interaction with Indy is so hilarious I was gut busting laughing almost theI got a chance to see this one as a limited re-release for the first time. Harrison Ford is just so amazing as Indy the addition of Sean Connery is perfect. His interaction with Indy is so hilarious I was gut busting laughing almost the entire time when these two were interacting. The plot is familiar but it doesn't really matter because Spielberg directs everything with such bravado that I was completely onboard once again. Nobody understands adventure better than Spielberg and this movie is so purely adventurous and fun! The action sequences are better than most blockbusters made today despite this film being 30 years old and the finale is so adrenaline fueled and I loved it. Everything is so practical and authentic and that is probably why it is still engaging. The Indiana Jones trilogy is truly one of the best adventure films ever made and this might be my favorite out of all of them along with Raiders.

A thrilling adventure epic with some good father / son dynamics between Sean Connery and Harrison Ford. Outside of being known as James Bond, I personally believe this to be Sean Connery's greatest role outside of Bond -- and a highA thrilling adventure epic with some good father / son dynamics between Sean Connery and Harrison Ford. Outside of being known as James Bond, I personally believe this to be Sean Connery's greatest role outside of Bond -- and a high recommendation for anyone interested to view any of the films which depict the dangerous exploits of Indiana Jones.In terms of action, there are some great set pieces in this one including a boat chase through the canals of Venice and race to beat a tank much later in the film. Sound effects, especially punches and slaps, have never sounded as good as in this film; elevating the distinct brutal nature of this series further.Although I thoroughly enjoyed this film, I admittedly didn't like Indy's love interest in this one - she isn't as memorable as what we were given in previous entries. I also found her true motives to be confusing. This is a minor complaint regardless, and shouldn't distract from the great cinematic fun to be found within.In conclusion, a strong recommendation from me. Even if you're not into these sorts of epics, you'll be sure to find some levels of enjoyment out of the relationship between the two main leads. It's well-paced, witty, and doesn't take itself too seriously - which is what I believe Indiana Jones has always been about from the start.
